title: KYUEM’S brightest: Graduates of today, leaders of tomorrow
summary: Picking a university can be an exciting time, as doors open up to potentially life-changing opportunities. It is a pivotal moment where students get to chart the course for their future. They have the chance to delve deeper into a subject they are passionate about, discover new interests they never knew existed, and develop the skills and knowledge that will set them on the path to their dream career. However, it is also natural to come across some hurdles to decision-making. It can be a challenge to find the right fit, not just in terms of interest and learning style, but also in identifying a platform that can help foster academicresilience, independence and intellectual growth.

title: SK On in talks to supply prismatic batteries
summary: SEOUL: South Korean electric vehicle (EV) battery maker SK On is in talks with automakers to supply prismatic batteries, expanding from its existing pouch-type batteries, a senior executive says, as it scrambles to turn around amid slowing global EV demand.
content:
The logo of SK On is pictured at its EV battery factory in Seosan, South Korea, October 19, 2023. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji/File Photo

SEOUL: South Korean electric vehicle (EV) battery maker SK On is in talks with automakers to supply prismatic batteries, expanding from its existing pouch-type batteries, a senior executive says, as it scrambles to turn around amid slowing global EV demand.

title: Taiwan, India threaten China’s top spot in EM equity portfolios
summary: New York: The race to replace China’s top spot in emerging market (EM) equity portfolios is heating up, with Taiwan and India running neck to neck as formidable rivals.
content:
New York: The race to replace China’s top spot in emerging market (EM) equity portfolios is heating up, with Taiwan and India running neck to neck as formidable rivals.

Thanks to record stock rallies, Taiwan and India now command more than 19% weightings each in the MSCI EM Index. That compares to China’s 22.8%, whose standing has steadily shrunk over the past few years, Bloomberg-compiled data show.

The rise of Taiwan and India is allowing investors to better diversif

title: Lagging agricultural technology poses risks to food security for Indonesian agriculture
summary: JAKARTA: Indonesian agriculture development has lagged for years as the country struggles to improve technology and human resources in the sector, with experts and farmers believing the condition will make it difficult to effectively safeguard the nation’s food security.
content:
A general view shows a parched section of a rice paddy during a drought in Japakeh on the outskirts of Banda Aceh on July 14, 2024. (Photo by CHAIDEER MAHYUDDIN / AFP)

JAKARTA: Indonesian agriculture development has lagged for years as the country struggles to improve technology and human resources in the sector, with experts and farmers believing the condition will make it difficult to effectively safeguard the nation’s food security.

title: Weak CBOT corn, soybeans heading toward grim achievement
summary: CHICAGO corn and soybean futures almost always undergo some kind of summer rally as US crop potential remains vulnerable to weather fluctuations, but traders this year have displayed little to no concern over supply scenarios.
content:
CHICAGO corn and soybean futures almost always undergo some kind of summer rally as US crop potential remains vulnerable to weather fluctuations, but traders this year have displayed little to no concern over supply scenarios.

Market momentum has been downward since US planting wrapped up in late May, and large speculators entered July with their most bearish-ever mid-year positions.

Heavy price pressure in July is not terribly unusual, especially when weather for US c

title: Franchise Group
investors sue former CEO
summary: NEW YORK: Franchise Group Inc investors have sued ex-chief executive officer (CEO) Brian Kahn and investment partner B. Riley Financial Inc, claiming shareholders were shortchanged in a US$2.6bil take-private buyout of the operator of franchised-retail brands.
content:
NEW YORK: Franchise Group Inc investors have sued ex-chief executive officer (CEO) Brian Kahn and investment partner B. Riley Financial Inc, claiming shareholders were shortchanged in a US$2.6bil take-private buyout of the operator of franchised-retail brands.

Kahn and his allies are accused in the suit of using their control of the company to wrongfully push through a US$30-per-share buyout in 2023.

The firm’s brands include Vitamin Shoppe, Representatives of Kahn and

title: Zahid open to Umno’s top two posts being contested at next party polls
summary: Umno president Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi is open to the party’s top two posts being contested in its 2026 election.
content:
MUAR (July 14): Umno president Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi is open to the party’s top two posts being contested in its 2026 election.

"According to the Umno constitution, party elections are held every three years. There is a clause that allows for elections to be postponed for up to 18 months, so it depends on the decisions of the supreme council and the Umno general assembly. We will adhere to the party constitution and regulations.

"I am open to this mat

title: FGV launches improved sustainability framework to help transform palm oil sector
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd has introduced its improved Sustainability Framework to support the nation's initiatives in transforming the palm oil industry and achieving broader sustainability objectives.In a statement, FGV said the framework expands on its current sustainability ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: FGV Holdings Bhd has introduced its improved Sustainability Framework to support the nation's initiatives in transforming the palm oil industry and achieving broader sustainability objectives.

In a statement, FGV said the framework expands on its current sustainability commitments and includes five key pillars: economic growth, governance, social, environment, and innovation and technology.

FGV group chief executive officer Datuk Nazrul Mansor said the framework demonstrates its commitment to inclusive

title: Amir Hamzah sees ringgit staging rebound in 2H2024
summary: Encouraging foreign direct investments by government-linked companies (GLCs) and government-linked investment companies (GLICs) to Malaysia, as well as monitoring the exchange of export and import revenues are among concerted efforts undertaken by the government to strengthen the ringgit, said Finance Minister II Datuk Seri Amir Hamzah Azizan.
content:
TUMPAT (July 14): Encouraging foreign direct investments by government-linked companies (GLCs) and government-linked investment companies (GLICs) to Malaysia, as well as monitoring the exchange of export and import revenues are among concerted efforts undertaken by the government to strengthen the ringgit, said Finance Minister II Datuk Seri Amir Hamzah Azizan.

He said he is confident that the country’s currency performance will improve in the second half of 2024 with integrated efforts and efficient fiscal ma

title: Amir Hamzah: Over RM250m in diesel leakages prevented after subsidy cut
summary: The government estimates that over RM250 million in diesel leakage has been prevented from smuggling or misappropriation at petrol stations along Peninsular Malaysia borders since targeted subsidy measures were implemented on June 10.
content:
TUMPAT (July 14): The government estimates that over RM250 million in diesel leakage has been prevented from smuggling or misappropriation at petrol stations along Peninsular Malaysia borders since targeted subsidy measures were implemented on June 10.

Finance Minister II Datuk Seri Amir Hamzah Azizan, stated that diesel sales decreased by 23% or 6.5 million litres per day, while commercial diesel sales increased by 4.8 million litres per day.

He explained that

title: Terengganu, Pahang, Sabah, Sarawak potential CCUS industry leaders — Rafizi
summary:
KUALA TERENGGANU (July 14): The government has identified Terengganu, Pahang, Sabah and Sarawak as potential leaders in the carbon capture, utilisation and storage (CCUS) industry.

Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli said this is because the four states have decommissioned oil wells and exist...
content:
KUALA TERENGGANU (July 14): The government has identified Terengganu, Pahang, Sabah and Sarawak as potential leaders in the carbon capture, utilisation and storage (CCUS) industry.

Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli said this is because the four states have decommissioned oil wells and existing terminal facilities suitable for CCUS activities.

title: Agrobank allocates RM200 mln for housing financing scheme for Felda settlers
summary: KUALA LUMPUR, July 13 (Bernama) -- Agrobank has allocated RM200 million for a financing scheme to help eligible Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) settlers own their first homes under the Affordable Homes Programme-i.In a statement, the bank said the scheme ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR, July 13 (Bernama) -- Agrobank has allocated RM200 million for a financing scheme to help eligible Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) settlers own their first homes under the Affordable Homes Programme-i.

In a statement, the bank said the scheme is a testament to Agrobank's dedication to empowering the settler community.

President and chief executive officer Datuk Tengku Ahmad Badli Shah Raja Hussin said applications for the financing facility have been promising, totalling RM137 million to-date.

title: Anwar: Felda to receive additional RM100m to cover diesel price hike
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Sunday announced an additional allocation of RM100 million to the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) to offset increased operating costs resulting from the implementation of the targeted diesel subsidy.
content:
SERDANG (July 14): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Sunday announced an additional allocation of RM100 million to the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda) to offset increased operating costs resulting from the implementation of the targeted diesel subsidy.

Anwar, who is also finance minister, said that the allocation was agreed upon following discussions with Felda chairman Datuk Seri Ahmad Shabery Cheek regarding challenges faced by Felda under the new subsidy scheme.

title: Inaugural ATEC 2024 in KL to promote technology innovation, technopreneurship
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The inaugural APAC Technopreneurship Empowerment Conference 2024 (ATEC 2024) will be held here to promote technology innovation and technopreneurship through strategic partnerships between the government and industry.Endorsed by the Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation (Mosti), the Centre of ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The inaugural APAC Technopreneurship Empowerment Conference 2024 (ATEC 2024) will be held here to promote technology innovation and technopreneurship through strategic partnerships between the government and industry.

Endorsed by the Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation (Mosti), the Centre of Regional Strategic Studies (CROSS) and the Southeast Asia Research Centre for Humanities (SEARCH) have joined forces with Wellous Group Ltd (Wellous) and key government agencies under Mosti to co-organise ATEC 2024,

title: Cutting red tape drives growth of EV charging stations - Tengku Zafrul
summary: IPOH: The number of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations nationwide increased by 12.5 per cent as of June 25, compared to the first quarter of this year, driven by the government's efforts to reduce bureaucratic hurdles in the installation process.Investment, ...
content:
IPOH: The number of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations nationwide increased by 12.5 per cent as of June 25, compared to the first quarter of this year, driven by the government's efforts to reduce bureaucratic hurdles in the installation process.

Investment, Trade, and Industry Minister Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz said that previously, approvals involved numerous agencies and ministries, including the Energy Commission, local authorities, and the Fire and Rescue Department.

"The increase over the past tw

title: Ringgit poised to trend higher to 4.65 against US dollar next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is poised to trend higher next week to 4.65 against the US dollar, supported by positive economic indicators, said an investment bank.Kenanga Investment Bank Bhd said the indicators include stable labour market conditions, record-high distributive trade ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is poised to trend higher next week to 4.65 against the US dollar, supported by positive economic indicators, said an investment bank.

Kenanga Investment Bank Bhd said the indicators include stable labour market conditions, record-high distributive trade sales values and Bank Negara Malaysia's status quo on the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR).

"This has helped bolster the ringgit, enabling it to overcome the greenback's strength and appreciate by more than 0.4 per cent on a Thursday-to-Thur

title: CPO futures expected to trade lower next week amid rising output concern
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade with a downside bias, given rising output expectation in the coming week, said palm oil trader David Ng."We expect prices to trade between ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade with a downside bias, given rising output expectation in the coming week, said palm oil trader David Ng.

"We expect prices to trade between RM3,850 per tonne and RM4050 per tonne next week," he told Bernama.

Meanwhile, Interband Group of Companies senior palm oil trader Jim Teh said the CPO market will be trading in the RM3,700 to RM3,800 per tonne range.

"This is essentially a technical correction due to the high

title: Bursa Malaysia likely to trade higher next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trade higher next week on persistent optimism for the local bourse, according to analysts. UOB Kay Hian Wealth Advisors head of investment research Mohd Sedek Jantan said the bulls are believed to still ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trade higher next week on persistent optimism for the local bourse, according to analysts. 

UOB Kay Hian Wealth Advisors head of investment research Mohd Sedek Jantan said the bulls are believed to still have the upper hand over the next couple of weeks, as long as the FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI (FBM KLCI) remains above the flag resistance turned support at 1,603. 

"The next target is seen at 1,630. Our optimism is supported by the progress of recovery in China," he told Bernama.

title: Boeing's latest B777-9 begins flight test after long delay
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Boeing's latest twin-engine aircraft model, the B777-9, has officially begun its flight test on Saturday (Malaysia time zone) with the US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) onboard after a long-delayed certification programme. Boeing said it received the ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Boeing's latest twin-engine aircraft model, the B777-9, has officially begun its flight test on Saturday (Malaysia time zone) with the US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) onboard after a long-delayed certification programme. 

Boeing said it received the Type Inspection Authorisation (TIA) from the FAA which gave the company the green light to start the flight test and the certification process – a key milestone in the airplane's development. 

"With TIA for the B777-9, we began certification fl

title: Malaysia's IPI to grow more robust in 2024: MIDF Research
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: MIDF Research has reaffirmed its forecast that the Industrial Production Index (IPI) will grow more robustly this year to 4.2 per cent from 0.7 per cent in 2023.The firm expects heightened external demand to enhance the production of various export ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: MIDF Research has reaffirmed its forecast that the Industrial Production Index (IPI) will grow more robustly this year to 4.2 per cent from 0.7 per cent in 2023.

The firm expects heightened external demand to enhance the production of various export products such as natural gas and electrical and electronics (E&E) components.

"Production of domestic-oriented products will also increase given the continued rise in domestic spending. 

"However, we are monitoring closely any possible downside risks fr

title: Fahmi scoffs at claims govt afraid of losing polls over ex-Bersatu MPs’ seats
summary: Pakatan Harapan (PH) communications director Fahmi Fadzil has refuted claims that the government was reluctant to declare vacant the six parliamentary seats and one state seat held by former Bersatu members due to fear of losing in the by-elections.
content:
SERDANG (July 14): Pakatan Harapan (PH) communications director Fahmi Fadzil has refuted claims that the government was reluctant to declare vacant the six parliamentary seats and one state seat held by former Bersatu members due to fear of losing in the by-elections.

The minister of communications said that the current government respects the provisions outlined in the Constitution (Amendment) (No. 3) Act 2022 (Act A1663) or the Anti-Party Hopping Act.

"This is

title: Minister moots new law placing onus on social media platforms to tackle cyberbullying
summary: Digital Minister Gobind Singh Deo has proposed that a new law be introduced, placing responsibility for misuse of social media, including cyberbullying, on social media platforms.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 14): Digital Minister Gobind Singh Deo has proposed that a new law be introduced, placing responsibility for misuse of social media, including cyberbullying, on social media platforms.

He said that he, together with Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil and Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Law and Institutional Reform) Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said brought up the cyberbullying issue, including the recent  death of TikTok influencer A Rajeswari —<

title: Breathing new life into Kundang
summary: In this issue, boutique developer SMD Group of Companies unveils its first commercial development in Kundang, Selangor. Dubbed Serai Avenue, the 104-shoplot development is located in the heart of Bandar Baru Kundang and poised to become the commercial heartbeat of the town.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 14): In this issue, boutique developer SMD Group of Companies unveils its first commercial development in Kundang, Selangor. Dubbed Serai Avenue, the 104-shoplot development is located in the heart of Bandar Baru Kundang and poised to become the commercial heartbeat of the town.

“A thriving commercial hub plays an important role in reviving an old town [like Kundang]. It can add the energy that was maybe missing before. Creating a new commercial hub to bring in new businesses not only serves

title: Making waves
summary: Desaru Coast in Johor is launching the Ombak Festival in a big way, bringing world-class names like Grace Jones, Macy Gray and The Cardigans to Malaysia for three days of music, food and fun in September. Festival director Karina Ridzuan shares the inspiration behind the idea, what to expect and why a music fest is best enjoyed to the beat of one’s own drum.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (July 14): Desaru Coast in Johor is launching the Ombak Festival in a big way, bringing world-class names like Grace Jones, Macy Gray and The Cardigans to Malaysia for three days of music, food and fun in September. Festival director Karina Ridzuan shares the inspiration behind the idea, what to expect and why a music fest is best enjoyed to the beat of one’s own drum.

“This is an international festival with a Malaysian soul,” she explains. Its name is, of course, inspired by the Malay word for “o
